comments:
*Marketing 396 provides a detailed introduction to the role of merchandising at various retailers, including apparel and other soft lines businesses, grocery stores, mass-merchandisers and "category killers.” Selected topics may include product development, line planning, sourcing, product lifecycle, forecasting, planning and allocation, pricing and markdowns, and vendor relations. 

Students enjoyed this class and thought it had a lot of practical value. It was a combination of lectures and guest speakers and was a "good overview in retail for someone with no experience."

Professor Sheridan is "wonderful and makes classes and assignments interesting." She had a "very down-to-earth attitude."

There was "a lot of work in a short period of time," including the group presentation and final paper. 

*This review is based on only 7 student comments.
